title: Frozen Research Vault Adventure #72
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Cryogenic Storage Bay
rooms.description: A frigid chamber lined with frosted cryogenic pods, their status lights blinking amber in the dim emergency lighting. Ice crystals coat every surface, and your breath forms clouds in the sub-zero air. Condensation drips from overhead pipes. Warning klaxons echo distantly through the facility. The vault was clearly evacuated in a hurry.

items.name: environmental control terminal
items.description: A wall-mounted terminal displaying temperature readings and system diagnostics
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Arctic Research Vault Omega - Established 2047. Temperature: -40°C. Emergency protocols active. Chief Scientist: Dr. Elena Frost. Lead Engineer: Marcus Webb. Biological containment: CRITICAL.

items.name: emergency supply locker
items.description: A metal locker containing emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: insulated thermal gloves
items.description: Heavy-duty gloves designed for handling frozen equipment

items.name: specimen storage cabinet
items.description: A reinforced cabinet with three compartments, each marked with biohazard symbols

items.name: research log datapad
items.description: A frozen datapad with Dr. Frost's research notes
items.text: Dr. Frost's Log: The specimens are becoming unstable. We established this vault in 2047 to contain them. If you're reading this, evacuate immediately through the control center to the escape tunnel. The middle compartment code is our founding year.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A keycard labeled 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL - CONTROL CENTER ACCESS'

items.name: cryogenic pod 17
items.description: A large pod with a viewing window, frost obscuring what's inside
items.text: Pod Status: SPECIMEN 17 - CONTAINMENT BREACH IMMINENT. Warning: Do not open. Evacuate to control center immediately.

items.name: maintenance workbench
items.description: A cluttered workbench with tools and equipment manuals

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A thick manual with emergency procedures
items.text: ARCTIC RESEARCH VAULT OMEGA: All biological research conducted in the laboratory wing. Chief Scientist Dr. Elena Frost oversees all operations. Emergency escape tunnel accessible from control center. Specimens stored in cryogenic storage.

items.name: reinforced security door
items.description: A heavy door with a card reader, leading to the control center. Frost has formed around the edges.

rooms.name: Central Control Center
rooms.description: The facility's command hub, filled with banks of monitors displaying critical system alerts. Red emergency lights pulse across control panels. A large window overlooks the frozen wasteland outside. The temperature is slightly warmer here, but still freezing. A sealed escape tunnel door dominates the far wall.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary control station with multiple screens showing facility status
items.text: FACILITY STATUS: Containment breach in progress. All personnel evacuated. Chief Scientist: Dr. Elena Frost. Specimens stored in cryogenic storage. Emergency tunnel requires authorization.

items.name: personnel assignment board
items.description: A digital display showing staff assignments and photos
items.text: STAFF ROSTER: Dr. Elena Frost - Chief Scientist, Biological Research. Marcus Webb - Lead Engineer, Systems Maintenance. Dr. Sarah Chen - Research Assistant, Laboratory Wing.

items.name: chief scientist's desk
items.description: Dr. Frost's desk with locked drawers and scattered papers

items.name: handwritten note
items.description: A note in Dr. Frost's handwriting
items.text: Personal reminder: I am the Chief Scientist responsible for this facility. If containment fails, the specimens in cryogenic storage must not escape. The escape tunnel is our only way out. - Elena

items.name: evacuation procedures document
items.description: Official emergency evacuation instructions
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION: In case of containment breach, proceed to escape tunnel. Security verification required. Questions: Who is the Chief Scientist? Where are specimens stored? What is your role?

items.name: emergency equipment locker
items.description: A locker containing survival gear

items.name: insulated thermal coat
items.description: A heavy coat designed for arctic conditions

items.name: facility identification badge
items.description: A badge identifying you as a researcher
items.text: ARCTIC RESEARCH VAULT OMEGA - Researcher - You are authorized personnel conducting vital research.

items.name: security monitor wall
items.description: Multiple screens showing different areas of the facility
items.text: Camera feeds show: Cryogenic storage - multiple pods with amber warnings. Laboratory wing - empty and dark. Escape tunnel - clear and accessible. Outside - blizzard conditions.

items.name: escape tunnel door
items.description: A sealed emergency exit with a security terminal. Three verification questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the Chief Scientist?
password_questions.hint: Check the control console, personnel board, and personal notes

password_questions.question: Where are the specimens stored?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention where specimens are kept

password_questions.question: What is your role?
password_questions.hint: Your facility badge identifies your position

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Tunnel
rooms.description: You've made it to the escape tunnel! A long corridor carved through ice and rock, lit by emergency strips along the walls. At the far end, you can see daylight and the outline of an emergency shelter. The howling wind from outside brings the promise of rescue. Behind you, the vault's alarms continue to blare, but you're safe now.

items.name: emergency evacuation sled
items.description: A sled equipped with supplies for arctic survival

items.name: emergency radio beacon
items.description: An activated beacon transmitting your location to rescue teams

items.name: tunnel exit
items.description: The opening leading to the emergency shelter and safety

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've escaped the Frozen Research Vault through the emergency tunnel. As you emerge into the arctic wind, you see the emergency shelter ahead and rescue helicopters approaching in the distance. The specimens remain contained in the vault behind you. You've survived the crisis and solved all the puzzles. You win!
